title: Digital Public Good

name.description: The name of the Digital Public Good.

isOwnershipExplicit.description: Is the ownership of the project and everything that the project produces clearly defined and documented?

copyrightURL.description: If yes - please link to the relevant copyright, trademarks, or ownership documentation for the project.

platformIndependence.description: 4. Does the license of libraries/dependencies undermine the openess of the project?

mandatoryDepsCreateMoreRestrictions.description: Does this open project have mandatory dependencies (i.e. libraries, hardware) that create more restrictions than the original license?

isSoftwarePltIndependent.description: If yes - are the open source components able to demonstrate independence from the closed component(s) and/or are there functional, open alternatives?

pltIndependenceDesc.description: If yes - please describe how the open source components are independent and/or list the open alternatives for the closed component:

isDocumentationAvailable.description:
Does some documentation exist of the source code, use cases, and/or functional requirements.
 For software projects, this should be present as technical documentation that would allow a technical person unfamiliar with the project to launch and run the software. For data projects, this should be present as documentation that describes all the fields in the set, and provides context on how the data was collected and how it should be interpreted. For content, this should indicate any relevant compatible apps, software, hardware required to access the content and any instructions about how to use it.

documentationURL.description: If yes - please link to the relevant documentation:

collectsNonPII.description: Does this project collect or use non-personally identifiable information (non-PII) data?

nonPIIAccessMechanism.description: If yes - describe the mechanism for extracting or importing non-personally identifiable information from the system in a non-proprietary format:

privacy.description: 7. Does the project adhere to privacy and other applicable international and domestic laws?

isPrivacyCompliant.description: Has this project taken steps to ensure adherence with relevant privacy, domestic, and international laws? For example, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) in the European Union or the Supplementary Act A/SA.1/01/10 on Personal Data Protection for the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) (yes/no)

standards.description: 8. Does the project adhere to standards and best practices?

implementBestPractices.description: Was this project built and developed according to or in adherence with any design, technical and/or sector best practices or principles? i.e. the Principles for Digital Development?

doNoHarm.description: 9. Does the project do no harm?

additionalInfoMechanismProcessesPolicies.description: Is there any additional information you would like to share about the mechanisms, processes or policies that this project uses to avoid doing harm?
